newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Bank of Scotland raises BankWest stake.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Bank of Scotland raises BankWest stake.

text.p: Bank of Scotland's Scottish Western Australian Holdings Pty Ltd said it acquired a further 7.08 million shares in Bank of Western Australia Ltd on Thursday for a total cost of A$18.35 million to increase its stake in BankWest to 53.05 percent from 51.47 percent.

Bank of Scotland said the acquisition of the shares confirmed its commitment to BankWest and followed last week's announcement of BankWest's intention to introduce employee and executive share schemes.
The purchase would help to ensure Bank of Scotland maintained its majority shareholding in BankWest following any issue of shares under these schemes, it said.
It said the purchases were made within the "creep" provisions of Australian corporate law.
These allow one company to acquire an additional three percent of another company every six months once its shareholding passes the normal takeover threshold of 20 percent.
BankWest shares closed five cents lower at A$2.55 on Thursday.
